content:
41. To whom was this addressed?“While it remained 
unsold, did it not remain your own?And after it was 
sold, was it not at your disposal? How is it that you 
have contrived this deed in your heart? Youhave not 
lied to men but to God.” 
A. Elymas    B.   Ananias  C.   Saul D. Sapphira 
 
42. “Truly I perceive that God shows no partiality” was said 
by  
A. Cornelius B.  Peter C.   Paul D. Philip 
43. After the killing of James the son of Zebedee, Herod 
also arrested Peter because 
A. Peter had promised to die with Jesus 
B. the Jews were pleased with the murder of James 
C. Herod wanted to show his zeal for the Law of 
Moses 
D. Peter was the head of the Church 
44. The proconsul of Paphos during the visit of Paul and 
Barnabas was 
A. Marcus Felix B. Lucius Publius 
C. Sergius Paulus D. Porcus Festus 
 
45. Which leading men among the brethren in Jerusalem, 
and who were themselves prophets were sent to 
Antioch with a letter in the company of Paul and 
Barnabas? 
A. Agabus and Barsabba 
B. Barsabba and ElymasC. Elymas and Judas 
D. Judas and Silas 
46. Lydia received Paul and Silas into her house when they 
came to 
A. Philippi B. Thessalonica C. Ephesus D. Troas 
 
47. Paul standing in the Areopagus, used the teaching of 
the poets of the people to introduce God the Creator at 
A. Thessalonica B. Athens C. Corinth D. Salamis 
 
48. On his final journey to Jerusalem, Paul lodged at the 
house of 
A. Jason B. Agabus C. Mnason D. Trophymus 
 
49. ‘In a short time you think to make me a Christian’ was 
said by 
A. Claudius Lysias   B. Felix the Governor 
C. King Agrippa D. Festus the Governor 
 
50. The final port of departure for Italy where the Centurion 
put Paul on board was 
A. Myra B. Alexandria C. Syracuse D. Fair 
Havens 
 
  CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE 1987  
 
1. ‘Our sister, be the mother of thousands and ten thousands; 
and my your descendants posses who was the sister? 
A. Rachel B. Rebekah C. Hannah D. Peniah 
 
2. ‘Cast out this slave woman with her son; for the son of 
this slave woman shall not be heir with my son Isaac. 
Who was the slave woman? 
A. Michael B. Sarah C. Hagar D. Puah 
 
3. ‘… thoms and thistles it shall bring forth to you and 
you shall eat the plants of field. In the sweat of your 
face you shall eat bread’.To whom were these words 
spoken? 
A. Cain B. Esau C. Adam D. Abel 
 
4. Abraham circumcised his son, Isaac, on the eighth day 
because. 
A. It was the custom of his tribe to do so 
B. God commanded him to do so 
C. He wanted to distinguish Isaac from Ishmael 
D. Isaac was the son of promise. 
 
5. Who among Joseph’s brothers was bound by Joseph 
when they went to Egypt to buy grain? 
A. Simeon    B.   Reuben  C.   Benjamin D. Judah 
 
6. Joshua was buried in the hill-country of 
A. Moab B. Naphtali C. Judah D. Ephraim 
 
7. ‘Take handfuls of ashes from the kiln and let Moses 
throw them toward heaven I the sight of Pharaoh’. 
A. the death of all Egyptian flocks and cattle 
B. the death of the first born and beast 
C. boils ad sores on man and beast 
D. locusts eating up every herbage. 
 
8. Whoever touches the ‘mountain of God’ shall be put to 
death by 
A. hanging B. shooting C. strangling D. beating 
9. ‘Take off the rings gold which are in the ears of your 
wives, your sons and your daughters and bring them 
to me’. 
A. decorating the Ark B. offering sacrifice 
C. erecting an altar 
D. fashioning a molten calf 
 
10. God commanded that Aaron should speak for Moses 
to the Israelites, but Moses should be to Aaron as 
A. God    B.   master   C.  brother D. priest 
 
11. On the first day when the Israelites left part of the bread, 
it bred worms and became foul, but on the sixth day 
when they left part of the bread it did not become foul 
because  
A. they roasted it immediately 
B. God commanded them to keep it 
C. Moses wanted to save them the trouble of 
searching for bread everyday 
D. by them they have discovered a better way of 
preserving it. 
12. Who was regarded as the greatest prophet in the Old 
Testament for seeing God face to face? 
A. Elijah   B.   Jeremiah C.  Isaiah D. Moses 
13. Whoever rebels against your commandment and disobeys 
your words, whatever you command him, shall be put 
to death: only be strong and of good courage. 
The above passage was addressed to: 
A. Moses B.   Joshua C.   Deborah D. Aaron
